alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Isle of Wight, southeastern York, southeastern James City and northeastern Surry Counties, the City of Poquoson and the City of Newport News through 330 PM EDT... At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Seaford to Lee Hall to Scotland. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Surry, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Busch Gardens, Scotland, Lee Hall, Denbigh, Tabb, Grove, Jamestown, Fort Eustis, Rushmere, Lackey, Chippokes State Park, Oriana, Newport News Golf Course, Poolesville, Oyster Point and Hog Island Game Reserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Surry; York
